title: Client Services Manager
description:
**Are you looking for a new role where you can make a difference in the lives of others?** **Do you want to work for an agency that truly cares about its employees and the community?**



This is a wonderful opportunity to work in the home healthcare arena, and be part of a team devoted to providing outstanding service, brightening the lives of our elderly clients and offering peace of mind to their families.



We are seeking a Client Services Manager who is amazing at customer service, loves talking on the phone, has exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, and is quick to learn new software. If you have a strong desire to help others, are a team player and would enjoy assisting our wonderful clients and field staff, this may be the opportunity you've been looking for.



The Customer Care Manager is responsible for scheduling of field staff, managing all touch-points (field staff, care recipient and family caregiver) and client care standards, and ensuring field staff are compatibility-matched while staying informed of client well-being.


**Experience with scheduling and working in the home care industry is a huge plus.**


***This is an on-site office position, Monday - Friday, 8:30 am to 5:00 pm.***


**Benefits**


* Weekly pay with direct deposit
* Monthly stipend for health insurance premiums
* Generous PTO and paid holidays
* Friendly supportive coworkers
* Comfortable and casual work environment
* Family atmosphere
* Bonus Opportunities
* Serve the community
* Room for growth and advancement


**Responsibilities**


* Customer/client care – effectively manages the customer care procedures and serves as the point of contact for client/customer relations.·
* Scheduling and care coverage – supports and uses all technology tools and resources to ensure proper business processes; schedules staff to meet client care needs and minimize non-billed overtime.
* Answers all in-coming calls with a smile, addressing the caller's needs, and transferring to appropriate party when necessary.
* Assists with the intake of new clients and informs potential clients of our services and reasons to utilize BrightStar Care over other agencies.
* Provide information to be used for statistics, reports, and records for purposes of evaluation and reporting of organization activities.
* Works cooperatively with office staff to select and choose the best caregiver to suite our clients' needs.
* Assures compliance with all local, state, and federal laws


**Requirements**


* Bachelor degree or a minimum of 2 years experience as a Customer Care Manager and/or managing customer service within a healthcare office setting; knowledge of HIPAA and healthcare office regulations
* Strong computer skills; Microsoft Office literate with the ability to learn new software
* Flexibility, good time management and multi-tasking skills A MUST
* Excellent organization, planning, interpersonal and project management skills
* Experience with staffing in a healthcare setting a huge plus


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Home Care Marketer / Business Development Specialist
description:
Angels on Call, a leading Licensed Home Care Service Agency (LHCSA) in the Hudson Valley, is seeking an energetic, organized, and driven individual to join our team as a Home Care Marketer / Business Development Associate. This predominately field-based position involves significant travel within the local area and offers a highly competitive salary and benefits package.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Identify, evaluate, and prioritize potential referral sources within our service territory in the Hudson Valley.
* Develop and implement an outreach plan aligned with our annual strategy to raise awareness and engage diverse referral sources.
* Foster and maintain strong business relationships with both new and existing partners.
* Present Angels on Call Homecare programs to community organizations, medical professionals, and healthcare facilities.
* Demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of our agency, services, and unique value proposition.
* Participate in marketing and networking events throughout the Hudson Valley to enhance our visibility and forge new relationships.
* Plan budgets for outreach activities and provide monthly reports on efforts.
* Build and maintain relationships with contract referral sources.
* Conduct individual/group presentations for healthcare professionals, seniors, and others to reach private pay home care patients.
* Enroll and refer private pay individuals to contract sources.
* Generate home care patient referrals from existing and potential accounts.


**Job Requirements:**


* Flexibility to travel within the Hudson Valley.
* Reliable transportation and a valid driver’s license.
* Previous healthcare marketing experience, preferably in Home Care.
* Knowledge of local referral sources and existing contacts within the territory.
* Ability to effectively communicate and build relationships.
* Experience in obtaining referrals for private pay patients is preferred.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and general computer proficiency.
* Self-driven, positive, and organized with excellent communication and time management skills.
* Detail-oriented with strong follow-up and organizational skills.
* Maintain a clean, professional image and demeanor at all times.


**What We Offer:**


* Highly competitive salary and benefits package.
* A supportive and dynamic work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.


If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of others and have the skills and experience we’re looking for, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity at Angels on Call.



Starting Salary 85K.


Commission package: 5% of business for the first 10 weeks.

title: Certified HHA - Manhattan, NY Only- Short Shifts
description:
**Job Title: Home Health Aide (HHA)**



Company: Affirmed Home Care


**About Us:**



Affirmed Home Care is a leading provider of personalized, high-quality in-home care services. We are committed to enhancing the lives of our clients by providing compassionate care tailored to their individual needs. As part of our team, you’ll be joining a supportive community of caregivers who are dedicated to making a difference.


**Position Overview:**



Affirmed Home Care is seeking a compassionate and reliable Home Health Aide (HHA) to provide essential care to our clients in their homes. The HHA will assist with daily living activities, ensuring that clients can maintain their independence and dignity while receiving the care they need. This role is ideal for someone who is dedicated to improving the quality of life for others and is passionate about home care.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Provide personal care assistance, including bathing, dressing, grooming, and toileting.


* Assist clients with mobility, transfers, and exercises as needed.


* Help with meal preparation, feeding, and ensuring clients follow prescribed dietary guidelines.


* Perform light housekeeping duties such as laundry, tidying up, and maintaining a safe living environment.


* Monitor and record changes in the client's physical or emotional condition, reporting any concerns to the supervising nurse or care coordinator.


* Accompany clients to medical appointments, errands, or social activities when necessary.


* Offer companionship and emotional support, fostering a warm and nurturing environment.


* Adhere to the client’s individualized care plan, following all instructions and protocols established by the care team.


* Ensure accurate and timely documentation of care provided, including daily logs and progress reports.


**Qualifications:**


* Valid Home Health Aide (HHA) certification in the state of New York.


* Minimum of 6 months - 1 year experience in home care, elder care, or related fields.


* Genuine compassion for the elderly and disabled, with a patient and empathetic approach to caregiving.


* Strong communication skills, with the ability to follow directions and report on client care effectively.


* Ability to work independently and manage time efficiently while providing high-quality care.


* Reliable transportation and a valid driver’s license (if required for the role).


* Current CPR certification (preferred but not required).


**Why Join Us?**


* Competitive pay with opportunities for advancement.


* Flexible scheduling to accommodate your personal and professional needs.


* Comprehensive training and ongoing support to help you succeed in your role.


* A welcoming and inclusive work environment where your contributions are valued.


* The chance to make a meaningful impact on the lives of those in need of care.

  



Affirmed Home Care is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

  



#ZR

title: Medical Office Assistant
description:
Overview:

Catholic Health Physicians Practices strives to deliver clinically excellent medical care to our patients.  

We are looking for a Medical Office Assistants who will provide the highest quality of patient care by being an integral part of the clinical team.
Job Details:
**DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Prepares exam rooms for use following protocol including: disinfecting, stocking all rooms, and checking vaccinations and medications availability for the day.
* Preps the patient chart with pre-visit planning by reviewing the next working day’s schedule and identifying gaps in care. The medical assistant is responsible for ensuring and/or obtaining the last mammogram and breast ultrasound, colonoscopy, immunizations and any clinical studies or consults that are required for that office visit
* Escorts patients to exam rooms. Directs patient flow for maximum efficiency.
* Collects and documents patient information, clinical data and other relevant information such as vital signs, height/weight, allergies, active medication list, chief complaint, pain screen and current symptoms.
* Obtains additional data from patient/significant other, EKG/lab/ diagnostic test results and other historical data. Reports findings to provider, recognizing abnormal findings or changes in condition.
* Confirms and clarifies written orders prior to implementation of delegated tasks.
* Collects, prepares and processes laboratory specimens for on-site and remote-site testing. Tracks and enters results in medical record. Performs quality control for waived testing and log maintenance
* Assist with front office duties: greeting patients, answering phones, and verifying insurances.
* Other duties assigned
 **Qualifications:**  

* Completion of an accredited Medical Assistant Program or 3+years documented medical assistant experience and completion of the CH Medical Assistant Assessment.
* BCLS training and current certification required from: American Heart Association or American Red Cross.
* Proficiency with care tasks such as phlebotomy, aseptic technique, etc

Posted Salary Range: USD $22.87 - USD $29.13 /Hr. :

This range serves as a good faith estimate and actual pay will encompass a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, and experience and position location. The salary range or rate listed does not include any bonuses/incentive, differential pay or other forms of compensation that may be applicable to this job and it does not include the value of benefits.

title: AVP, Emergency Medical Services
description:
Job Details:

JOB SUMMARY

  

The Assistant Vice President (AVP) for Emergency Medical Services (EMS) will lead and manage the EMS operations of Catholic Health. This role includes building and overseeing EMS 911, interfacility transports and direct dial operations, supporting and partnering with community-based volunteer EMS providers, and managing relationships and joint operations with contracted commercial ambulance services. The AVP will ensure the highest standards of emergency medical care and operational efficiency, while fostering collaboration with internal and external stakeholders to enhance service delivery across the Nassau and Suffolk regions.

  

In addition, the role requires expertise in EMS education and training. In this capacity, the AVP for EMS will oversee education and training programs for EMS providers both within and outside the Catholic Health System. The AVP will also coordinate and oversee American Heart Association (AHA) Basic Life Support, Advanced Life Support, and Pediatric Life Support training programs.

  



Additionally, the AVP for EMS will function as the health system liaison between hospital staff, pre-hospital care providers, members of the community and contracted ambulance companies.

  

RESPONSIBILITIES

#### 

#### **Operational Leadership:**

* Oversee daily operations of the health system’s EMS, ensuring compliance with all county, state and federal regulations.
* Develop and implement strategic plans to enhance EMS service delivery and operational efficiency.
* Coordinate with contracted ambulance commercial services and volunteer EMS providers to ensure seamless integration and optimal utilization of resources.
* Monitor performance metrics and quality assurance programs to ensure high standards of patient care.
* Collaborate with EMS Outreach Coordinators from Catholic Health hospitals to align services and objectives

#### **Community Support and Partnership:**

* Serve as the primary liaison with community-based volunteer EMS providers, offering support, training, and resources to enhance their capabilities.
* Foster strong relationships with community stakeholders, including local government, public safety agencies, and community organizations.
* Lead initiatives to improve community health outcomes through education, outreach, and preventive programs.

#### **Financial Management:**

* Develop and manage the EMS department budget, ensuring cost-effective allocation of resources.
* Identify and pursue opportunities for grants and other funding sources to support EMS operations and community initiatives.
* Monitor financial performance and implement strategies to optimize revenue and control costs.

#### **Staff Development and Leadership:**

* Recruit, train, and mentor EMS personnel, fostering a culture of excellence, teamwork, and continuous improvement.
* Ensure ongoing professional development, and EMS and AHA certification for CH EMS staff as well as volunteer providers and other EMS partners
* Promote a safe and inclusive work environment, adhering to health system policies and procedures.

#### **Compliance and Quality Assurance:**

* Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements, including state EMS laws and accreditation standards.
* Oversee the development and implementation of quality improvement initiatives.
* Conduct regular audits and reviews to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions as needed.
  

QUALIFICATIONS

 **Education:**


* A bachelor’s degree in emergency medical services, healthcare administration, public health, or a related field; master’s degree preferred.

**Work Experience**

* Minimum of 7 years of progressive EMS experience, including at least three years in a leadership role

**Licenses and Certifications**
* New York State EMT-P Certification (National Registry preferred)
* Critical Care Paramedic Certification (preferred)
* AHA BCLS, ACLS Instructor Certification (preferred)

**Skills and Abilities**

* Knowledge of NYS, Nassau, and Suffolk County EMS systems, regulations, and accreditation standards.
* Knowledge of EMS educational standards, including Certification, Re-certification, and Continuing Medical Education
* Knowledge of the NYS DOH EMS Quality Improvement Process
* Strong leadership and team management abilities.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proven ability to develop and implement strategic plans.
* Financial acumen and experience managing budgets.
* Ability to build and maintain collaborative partnerships.
* Excellent organizational skills with a proven track record of meeting objective deadlines

title: Dispensary General Manager
description:
**Who We Are:**


Sweetspot Brands, a leading multi-state cannabis operation with licenses across five states on the East Coast, is dedicated to providing worry-free cannabis experiences. Our mission is to help people stress less and enjoy more through the power of the plant. Approachable by nature, we treat each customer and employee individually, ensuring everyone feels welcomed. Sustainability is at our core, making thoughtful choices to reduce our environmental footprint. Join us for a premium, approachable, and sustainable cannabis journey with Sweetspot Brands.


Discover Your **'Sweetspot'** with Us: Where Talent and Opportunity Meet!

*We are fully committed to building a safe and inclusive workplace where our team can think differently, challenge the status quo, and enjoy themselves along the way. Our stance on harassment or discrimination is absolute: we have zero tolerance. We embrace diversity and remain steadfast in our commitment to fair hiring practices. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.*

**The Impact:**


The Dispensary Manager plays a vital role in supporting Sweetspot Brands' efforts to drive retail growth. Responsible for various tasks, including overseeing the day-to-day operations of the dispensary, and ensuring compliance with the Vermont Cannabis Control Board Regulations. The Dispensary Manager contributes directly to the success of our Sweetspot initiatives. If you're passionate about providing high quality products to our customers, and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, we invite you to join our team and be part of our mission to redefine the cannabis experience.

**The Role**:

* Hire, train, and manage a dispensary team.
* Develop, implement and train all staff on Standard Operating Procedures in accordance with Vermont Cannabis Control Board regulations and Sweetspot standards.
* Manage and oversee compliant inventory control measures and conduct weekly audits.
* Follow all existing inventory and inspection procedures to ensure full compliance in performing essential job functions.
* Maintain an intimate knowledge of all aspects of the dispensary and provide staff support when issues arise.
* Report weekly profit and loss reports comparing reporting data to actual cash receipts.
* Work with the accounting team for daily maintenance of financial accounts.
* Maintain daily receipts, expenses, and reporting.
* Analyze and report findings on key performance indicators.
* Proper processing and filing of Invoices, manifests, and vendor licensing.
* Report city and state sales tax according to state regulation.


Qualities We Value:

* Someone who holds themselves to a high standard of compliance.
* Wants to help manage and develop staff into future leaders in the dispensary.
* Cares about working with local vendors and businesses.
* An ability to deescalate potential tense situations.
* Someone who has an understanding of the cannabis industry.
* A strong attention to detail.


What You Bring:

* 3-5 years of experience managing staff, handling budgets and general operations knowledge.
* Demonstrated ability to create and modify SOPs.
* Ability to handle interpersonal relationships and solve conflicts between employees.
* Ability to demonstrate proficiency in the following areas:
* Personnel management
* Inventory Management
* Development and implementation of quality control measures
* Problem-solving
* Physical ability to walk back and forth across the facility and lift/move up to 50 lbs if necessary.
* Must be 21 or older.


Benefits & Perks:


During the interview, we'll discuss additional perks and benefits. Some highlights include:

* Health insurance
* Life and AD&D Insurance
* Paid vacation and holidays
* Parental leave
* Short-term disability
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Bereavement Support
* Sick Leave


$65,000/year


If you're ready to showcase your skills and embark on a rewarding journey in the cannabis industry, we want to hear from you. Join us in shaping the future of cannabis on the East Coast!


Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the responsibilities. However, the Company reserves the right to adjust, modify, or reassign work tasks and responsibilities as needed to meet changing business needs, operational requirements, or other factors.

**Job Type:** Full-time

**Pay:** From **$65,000.00** per year

**Benefits:**

* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave

**Shift:**

* 10-hour shift
* 8-hour shift
 **Work Location:** In person

title: Customer Service Representative

title: Sample Lab Operations Supervisor
description:
**OnScent** has an opportunity for a career minded Sample **Lab Operations Supervisor** who will be the driving force behind the seamless operation of both our Fragrance Creative & Sample Labs. This role is pivotal in leading a dedicated team of lab technicians, material handlers, and shipping coordinators, ensuring the punctual delivery of high-quality fragrance samples.


Your responsibilities extend to the implementation of process enhancements, including system upgrades and the establishment of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). You will be a key player in our continuous pursuit of operational excellence.


Initially, you will report directly to the Director of Scent Design, with a dotted line to the Senior Vice President of Operations. Over time, your reporting line will transition into Operations. The position is located in Hackensack, NJ with regular travel to Norwood, NJ.

**Responsibilities:**

* Coordinate and supervise the production and distribution of fragrance samples to support product development, sales, and marketing teams.
* Ensure that fragrance samples are prepared accurately and in a timely manner, following established guidelines and quality standards.
* Implement and enforce stringent quality control processes to maintain the consistency and quality of fragrance samples.
* Oversee the day-to-day operations of the sample and application labs, including equipment maintenance, cleanliness, and organization.
* Manage inventory levels of sample materials, fragrance ingredients, and packaging supplies to meet demand.
* Recruit, train, and lead a team of lab technicians and application chemists.
* Foster a collaborative and productive work environment, and provide guidance and mentorship to team members to enhance their skills and efficiency.
* Maintain accurate records of inventory levels and consumption of fragrance ingredients and sample materials.
* Implement efficient inventory control measures to minimize waste and ensure timely re-ordering
* Collaborate closely with Perfumers, Evaluators and Analytical Perfumer to prioritize sample production based on project requirements, timelines, and promotional campaigns.
* Maintain clear communication channels to ensure the lab meets project needs.
* Prepare regular reports on sample production activities, inventory status, and lab performance.
* Maintain detailed records of sample formulations, production processes, and distribution for traceability and analysis.
* Develop and manage the lab budget, including cost control and resource allocation.
* Identify cost-saving opportunities while maintaining the quality and efficiency of sample production.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or higher in chemistry, chemical engineering, or a related field. Relevant certifications or training in fragrance or laboratory management are a plus.
* Must have 1-3 years experience directly supervising in a lab environment.
* Previous experience in a fragrance lab or a related environment is preferred.
* Strong knowledge of fragrance ingredients, formulations, and sample production processes.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
* Proficiency in laboratory equipment operation and data tracking.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining sample quality and accuracy.
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
* Knowledge of safety protocols and regulatory requirements related to fragrance sample production.
* Strong problem-solving skills and adaptability to changing priorities and demands.

 **Why Join** **OnScent****?**


At OnScent, we are committed to fostering a culture of innovation and excellence. This position is ideal for someone looking to grow their career in a challenging and rewarding environment. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth and development. Join our team and contribute to our mission of delivering high-quality products through best-in-class manufacturing practices.

**OnScent** **is an Equal Opportunity Employer**


We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Customer Service Training & Quality Manager
description:
Overview:

Interstate Waste Services is the most progressive and innovative provider of solid waste and recycling services in the country! We primarily service Northern New Jersey, Southern New York State, New York City, with a landfill located in Ohio, where we also own and operate a state-of-the-art rail-served landfill. We cater to a diverse range of residential, industrial, and commercial customers. Our mission has always been to provide our customers with the highest quality waste, recycling, and environmental services, while keeping focus on employee, customer, and environmental safety.  

What makes our company culture unique is we have mastered the ability to balance the standards of a large corporate company while maintaining our small business family style culture. **Summary****:** We value people that are passionate about providing excellent customer service. Our employees thrive in being part of a team who creates and cultivates professionalism in the workplace. Our focus of expertise is Service, Customer Service, B2B and B2C. The role of the Training & Quality Manager ensures that business procedures, systems, and processes are in place and followed effectively and that staff is trained properly across all domains. Creates, implements, and improves on systems, SOPs, and quality related and training issues providing ongoing support to the Director and downstream for process and data-oriented tasks.
Responsibilities:
* Develop, review, and update SOPs, QRGs, Knowledge Base articles, and AI intents; streamline recurring tasks into clear, actionable SOPs, and address issues effectively.
* Conduct blind tests to ensure changes are properly implemented; establish a feedback loop for continuous improvement.
* Identify gaps, missing information, and areas for improvement; create and execute quality enhancement initiatives.
* Understand the roles of first-level agents, quality teams, SMEs, TLs, and Supervisors to ensure all processes and systems are accurately executed.
* Monitor all customer service queues (phone and email) daily and conduct weekly calibration sessions.
* Work with the core team to develop and implement quality improvement strategies.
* Track and analyze key quality performance metrics to identify trends and address emerging quality issues.
* Ensure processes remain efficient and up-to-date.
* Review and enhance training materials across various platforms (Teams, PPT, OneNote, Adobe, SharePoint, etc.).
* Oversee, coordinate, and track staff training progress to ensure effective on-the-job training (OJT).
* Assess staff knowledge and skills, provide retraining as needed, and document all training phases.
* Assist with scheduling training for new staff members.


Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience preferred.
* Proven ability to manage workflows and oversee daily operations in a dynamic call center environment.
* Experience in team development and leadership.
* Expertise in change management.
* Background in delivering training and coaching, ranging from junior team members to advanced Train the Trainer programs.
* Innovative approach to training with a focus on interactive learning.
* Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines and achieve targets.
* Proficient in creating and following standard operating procedures (SOPs) and systems.
* Strong commitment to quality and customer service.
* Exceptional attention to detail.Skilled in fostering employee morale and supporting team members in reaching their full potential.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with a focus on clarity, detail, and timeliness.
* Self-motivated with strong prioritization, management, and organizational abilities.
* Collaborative team player with a proactive attitude and strong sense of ownership

title: Rehabilitation Technician
description:
Alliance Orthopedics, an industry-leading multidisciplinary practice, is seeking a Rehabilitation Technician to guide patients through therapeutic exercise and assist with rehabilitation protocols. To be successful in this role, a Rehabilitation Technician must be positive, energetic, and compassionate when working with a wide variety of patients.


The ideal candidate will assist the Physical Therapist and other specialties during sessions, and will also be able to perform basic administrative and clerical duties.

**Summary of Responsibilities:**

* Assist patients to and from the waiting area and therapy area
* Lift and move patients with mobility issues from tables and chairs
* Guide patients through therapeutic exercises assigned by the Physical Therapist(s)
* Assist with patient progression through the use of PPTs: Physical Performance Testing (Functional Movement Screening/ computerized strength testing/ balance assessments)
* Set up applicable therapy equipment and modalities as required
* Continuously sanitize therapy areas after every patient
* Assist the floor staff with inventory and product replenishment
* Assist patients as they complete their functional rehabilitation programs
* Maintain a safe and steady flow of patients as individuals finish up and arrive on site
* Monitor patients' progress during sessions and collaborate with provider for progression/regression in PT program(s)
* Maintain open communication with fellow rehabilitation technicians, Athletic Trainers, and floor staff
* Report patient signs or symptoms to the provider(s) and administrative staff
* Comply with company rules, regulations, and procedures
* Support marketing initiatives by attending marketing and outreach events as requested
* Maintain professional relationships with all employees and adhering to company policies regarding

**Requirements:**

* Pursuing a Bachelor's degree or already obtained a degree in Exercise Science, Kinesiology, or related field
* Minimum 1 year experience or equivalent
* Physical strength to lift and move patients
* Patience and compassion
* Excellent interpersonal skills

**Why Join Us:**

* Evidence-based medical practice treating patients from all walks of life
* Revolutionary Team approach to medicine
* Cutting-edge facilities that feature technology such as Alter-G, DRX9000 Spinal Decompression, Class IV Laser, Game Ready, and NormaTec Compression Therapy
* Flexible hours and schedule
* Real-world experiences to prepare for career in healthcare
* Reference letters to submit with your application based on individual performance


Job Type: Full-time

title: Clinical Athletic Trainer
description:
**Clinical Athletic Trainer**


Alliance Orthopedics, the region's most dynamic multidisciplinary practice, is seeking an energetic, motivated, and articulate team player to join our team! Our Clinical Athletic Trainers provide direct patient care working side-by-side with our conservative care team of chiropractors, physical therapists, occupational therapists, exercise physiologists, and more! ATCs are an integral part of our sports medicine team, and function additionally as liaisons to our medical doctors, orthopedic surgeons, functional medicine practitioners, and pain management physicians. A licensed athletic trainer brings a unique role and perspective to the rehab floor of our practice. Not every ATC is looking for a traditional sideline position, and that's why Alliance Orthopedics provides ATCs the opportunity and resources to utilize their full scope of practice within our clinic-based model!

**ON THE JOB TRAINING PROVIDED!!! (Must possess a valid Athletic Trainer License in the state of New Jersey to be considered for the role)**

**Summary of Responsibilities:**

* Build rapport and relationships with our patients! Understand THEIR GOALS!
* Provide engaging one-on-one care with patients, allowing them to feel heard during evaluations
* Oversee the execution of PPTs: Physical Performance Testing (Functional Movement Screening, computer-recorded strength testing)
* Develop and tailor patient-specific exercise programs as part of the patient's overall care plan
* Monitor, review, and make recommendations to treating providers on progressions/regressions within patients' care plans
* Effectively and compassionately communicate available services and the care plan objectives to patients and their families
* Create, monitor, review, and update patient home exercise programs
* Stay up-to-date on current techniques and research pertaining to therapeutic modalities (Alter-G treadmill, DRX-9000 traction, Normatec, Game Ready, Litecure Laser, cryotherapy, etc.)
* Provide ongoing contribution to meeting and exceeding the goals of the Athletic Training Team
* Participate in marketing events, initiatives, contests, and company outings with our team
* Develop strategies that streamline patient care and office flow (Collapse timeframes, and identify efficiencies!)
* Ensure an outstanding patient experience by becoming part of our fun, energetic, high octane, and motivating clinic atmosphere!
* Stand out as a valuable team member, bringing energy in collaboration with all other healthcare disciplines in a team setting to help our patients get BETTER EVERYDAY!

 **Requirements:**

* Valid New Jersey Athletic Trainer License **REQUIRED**
* Degree from and accredited Athletic Training Education Program
* 2+ years of experience in a healthcare setting, strong understanding of treatment options for sports or related injuries/conditions
* Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and customer service skills, especially the ability to show compassion for patients coming from all walks of life
* Understanding of therapeutic treatments, manual massage, exercise prescription, and physical therapy techniques and equipment
* Familiarity with electronic medical record systems
* Willingness to challenge patients, other team members, and yourself!

**Benefits:**

* Consistent, predictable work schedule (no overnights or extended travel!)
* Clinic-based opportunity for ATCs (no rain gear necessary!)
* Collaborative environment fostering continued growth in a multidisciplinary approach to medicine
* VERY competitive salary and a runway for professional growth
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* Accrued paid time off, sick time, and six paid company holidays
* Annual CEU reimbursement budget for licensed clinicians
* Retirement savings account with a percentage based company match

**Job Details:**

* Full-time
* One Location


COVID-19 considerations: Alliance Orthopedics is educating employees and patients about steps they can take to protect themselves and others through the implementation of the CDC recommendations. We are also implementing additional measures to keep our facilities clean.

description:

Alliance Orthopedics, the region's most dynamic multidisciplinary practice, is seeking an energetic, motivated, and articulate addition to our team! Our Chiropractic Physicians work side-by-side with our medical and conservative care teams. Chiropractors are an integral part of our team of medical doctors, orthopedic surgeons, functional medicine practitioners, and pain management physicians. Additionally, our Chiropractic Physicians function as medical liaisons within our conservative care team of physical therapists, clinical athletic trainers, occupational therapists, exercise physiologists, and more! title: Research Assistant | Laboratory of Molecular Pathogenesis
description:
Organization Overview: Transcription is a universal biological process and a prime target for therapeutics against pathogens. The Campbell lab operates at the interface between biochemistry, structural biology, and microbial pathogenesis. They focus on the regulation of gene expression and RNA synthesis in two deadly pathogens, Mycobacterium tuberculosis and coronaviruses, to illuminate fundamental mechanisms and contribute to drug development. Overview:

The Research Assistant will execute scientific experiments under the guidance of senior scientists as well as help maintain laboratory functions such as making general solutions or calibrating equipment.
Responsibilities:

Responsibilities include:* Conduct experiments involving cloning, expressing and purifying proteins
* Maintain laboratory functions such as making general solutions or calibrating equipment


Qualifications:

Required:* Bachelor's degree
* A commitment of two years
* Must be adept at using general lab equipment such as centrifuges, pH meters, pipettes, gel electrophoresis
* Skills in basic chemistry and microbiology lab techniques
* Cloning experience
* Experience in over expressing and purifying proteins is preferred

  

The Rockefeller University does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service or other non-merit factor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to the characteristics listed above.  

The salary of the finalist selected for this role will be set based on various factors, including but not limited to organizational budgets, qualifications, experience, education, licenses, specialty, and training. The hiring range provided represents The Rockefeller University's good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting.

title: Laboratory Manager | Laboratory of Chemistry and Cell Biology
description:
Organization Overview: We study molecular mechanisms required for the stable propagation of our genomes with the goal of developing new therapies to treat cancer. Errors in cell division have been linked to diseases and developmental defects in humans. We combine the discovery and use of chemical probes,synthetic chemistry,biochemistry,biophysics,and quantitative cell biology to answer long-standing questions relating to cell division. Studying cell division also provides us an opportunity to develop new approaches for the analysis of other complex cellular mechanisms. Overview:

The Laboratory Manager's duties will be divided across lab management / administrative and technical /scientific duties. Administrative duties will primarily involve organizing scientific meetings of lab members or guests, general product ordering and lab organization (~65% time). Scientific research duties will initially center around molecular biology (~35% time). The scientific focus will evolve as the project does.
Responsibilities:

Lab management/administrative duties:* Place lab orders; Deal with issues involving receipt or non-receipt of items and payment
* Establish accounts and monitor standing orders and equipment service contracts
* Oversee charges from Resource Centers and other internal organizations (e.g. lab safety)
* Responsible for organizing the following general lab upkeep, including:
+ Keep stock of standard consumables and reorder as needed
+ Maintain lab inventories of cell lines, antibody, biochemicals
+ Check -80 freezer for temperature and ice build-up. Organize and assign space to lab members
+ Check -20 freezer and refrigerators for organization and maintenance. Organize and assign space to lab members
+ Oversee training of users and maintenance of key lab equipment (e.g. centrifuges, FPLC) and coordinate repairs
+ Check LN2 storage

* Aid research projects (as described above)
* Act as Lab Safety Officer: looking for safety violations (eyewash blocked, unlabeled waste, ethanol in cold room); organizing annual lab safety training updates for all lab members
* Schedule Lab Meetings and sending reminders, order food, set up AV (including Zoom)
* Assist in organizing meetings for visitors (3-4 times each year)
* Welcome new lab members and introduce them to equipment/inventories/ordering and other established lab procedures.
* Assist with archiving data annually, when members leave or following publications.
* Assist in updating lab website and Twitter account
* Supervise part-time lab helper and fill-in when lab helper is away
* Perform related duties and responsibilities as assigned/requested
* Assist with reimbursements associated with travel/meetings/lab events
* Assist with shipping lab reagents requested by others

  

Scientific research duties* Assist with maintaining plasmid stocks, cell lines, and molecular biology projects


Qualifications:

Requirements:* Bachelor’s degree required; educational emphasis in Biology (including molecular biology and biochemistry) strongly preferred.
* Minimum 3 years lab experience
* Skills required include standard molecular / cell biological bench skills (solution preparation, plasmid purification, restriction digests, cell and tissue culture, electrophoretic analyses)
* Molecular cloning experience is essential
* Must be detail oriented, highly organized, and computer literate

  

The Rockefeller University does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service or other non-merit factor. title: IT Support Analyst
description:
Overview / About us:

Lumanity is dedicated to improving patient health by accelerating and optimizing access to medical advances. We partner with life sciences companies around the world to generate evidence to demonstrate the value of their product, translate the science and data into compelling product narratives, and enable commercial decisions that position these products for success in the market. We do this through strategic and complimentary areas of focus: Asset Optimization and Commercialization, Value, Access, and Outcomes, Medical Strategy and Communications, and Real-World Evidence.
Responsibilities / Position overview:

We are seeking a savvy IT Support Analyst to join our global IT department. As an IT Support Analyst, you will serve as the first point of contact for IT issues across the company and ensure all IT related inquiries are handled in professional and supporitive manner.  

This role is based out of our office in Morristown, New Jersey, but allows for a flexible hybrid schedule (minimum 3 days/week in office). Travel to other offices throughout the US (east coast) may be needed.  

As a member of the Infrastructure and Operations team, your main duties will consist of IT Support Service Delivery, and IT Operations and Projects. **IT Support Service Delivery Responsibilities:*** Acting as level one and, at times, level two systems support for all Enterprise people and contract workers using both broad technical and customer relationship skills ensuring timely and effective problem resolution.
* Troubleshooting PC/laptop related problems either via phone or by using remote tools.
* Identifying and escalating issues to the correct members of the technical team while ensuring they are resolved in suitable timelines and to appropriate priorities.
* Logging and managing incidents and service requests via the standard ITSM tools and guidelines and ensuring service levels are met, escalating delays and issues within appropriate timescales.
* Following up with customer’s status and information as problems are resolved.
* Working with external vendors when necessary to perform advanced troubleshooting which may include not only infrastructure products but security vendors when necessary.
* Using standard practices and guidelines including support structures and escalation protocols, internal and external, to ensure prompt and documented problem resolution.
* Maintaining a high level of knowledge for the installed application base within the enterprise where the application has been moved to ongoing support.

**IT Operations and Project Responsibilities:*** Working on technical projects with supervision from the IT Support Manager and members of the infrastructure team.
* On-boarding, migrating and off-boarding users according to service levels.
* Checking backups and providing external IT Department contact.
* Ensuring hardware and software assets are recorded properly in asset registers.
* Performing system administration for IT infrastructure by installing upgrades and regularly released patches for Microsoft-based servers/desktops as well as telephony systems.


Qualifications:
* Degree in Computer Science or related field or 3 years equivalent work experience.
* One to three years demonstrated experience using ITIL v4 methodologies preferred.
* Hands-on experience working within a helpdesk environment.
* Application/systems support experience is desirable with:
	+ Laptops, PC’s, macOS, iPhones, Androids
	+ AD, DFS, DNS, WSUS, Print Services
	+ Microsoft Windows 10/11 Troubleshooting
	+ Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Teams)
	+ Microsoft Exchange (On-Prem/365)
	+ Microsoft Windows Server 2016/2019
	+ Patch/Security Management (WSUS, Group Policy, Update Rings)
	+ Deployment Technologies (SCCM/AutoPilot/In-Tune)
	+ Wired and Wireless networking technologies
	+ JAMF Device Management and Security
	+ Backup technologies (Veeam, Egnyte)
	+ Automation of AD and Exchange (PowerShell)
	+ Fortinet VPN and Direct Access (or other remote working technologies)
	+ Office 365 Administration
* Excellent problem solving and customer service skills


Benefits:

We offer our employees a comprehensive benefits package that focuses on what matters to you – health and well-being, personal finances, professional development, and a healthy work/life balance:

* Competitive salary plus bonus scheme
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance options
* 401(k) plan with employer match
* Generous amount of paid time off annually + 10 paid holidays & 2 floating holidays
* Flexible spending accounts for health and dependent care
* Health savings account option with employer contribution
* Employee Assistance Program
* Paid short-term and long-term disability coverage
* Life insurance at 1.5x base salary

*and much more*


-:
*Employees can expect to be paid a salary between $55,000-$75,000. The salary range is merely an estimate and may vary based on an applicant’s location, skills, prior experience, professional qualifications, and other relevant factors.*

title: Vice President Facilities & Workplace Operations
description:
Unit Description: **Position is required to be based in the greater New York City area. Candidates must reside within commutable distance to work on site 3 days a week with 10-15% travel to other locations.**


Sodexo is seeking an inspirational and passionate **Vice President Facilities and Workplace Operations** to launch and implement a new premium multinational financial services corporation account. This is a newly created position and is a dynamic opportunity to interact with onsite day-to-day operations and lead our growing IFM and Workplace business.


The Vice President of Facilities and Workplace Operations is an entrepreneurial and highly empowered role which owns the P&L, delivers results and innovation, and draws from a well-established global service network to deliver world class solutions for our client. This leader will excel at building client relationships, team leadership, and have a deep understanding of a broad range of self-delivered and contracted services. Will have direct reports operating FM services in several US sites with some international locations.


This role will lead a 20M portfolio with the opportunity to triple in next few years. The current scope of services for this portfolio includes soft services such as conference services, hospitality, landscaping, and janitorial. The work environment is office space and data centers located throughout metropolitan areas in US and Canada.


The successful candidate will be a client centric leader and have a deep understanding of client needs, preferences, and pain points and build a culture of doing business that focuses on creating the best experience for the customer to create brand loyalty. In addition, have strong analytical capabilities to drive insights from data to create action plans for retaining all current business, developing strong teams and optimizing profitability to grow the business. Enjoys taking ownership to find solutions to diverse challenges, thinks creatively, and thrives under scrutiny and time-bound targets. Has a bias toward action and speed of execution.

**Is this opportunity right for you? We are looking for candidates who:**

* Have experience with large multi-location facilities in operation, managing teams with a hospitality focused service delivery while maintaining standards and processes.
* Experience with workplace services, conference centers and managing a self-performance-based team is highly preferred.
* Have extensive experience in a client facing leadership role and client centric leadership methodology with exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to connect with all audiences including c-suite.
* Have strong client relationship skills, proactive team and customer engagement and growth mindset.
* Have strong analytical skills to make data driven decisions to drive best in class operational excellence.
* Prior union experience with SEIU union a huge plus.
* Have strong P&L background.
* Have proven experience developing and executing a strategy to accelerate business growth.
* Can play a key role and enthusiastically support the succession planning and development of key personnel.

What We Offer:

Sodexo offers fair and equitable compensation, partially determined by a candidate's education level or years of relevant experience. While the budgeted range for the position is posted, Sodexo salary offers are based on a candidate's specific criteria, like experience, skills, education and training.
Qualifications & Requirements:

Basic Education Requirement- Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Basic Management Experience- 10 years
Basic Functional Experience- 10 years in facilities management, engineering, management of business/operations service in both soft and hard facilities services  

Sodexo is an EEO/AA/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran employer.
company_description: Working with Sodexo is more than a job; it’s a chance to be part of something greater because we believe our everyday actions have a big impact.

Sodexo is an EEO/AA/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran employer.

description:

**Cranbury, NJ**

description:

Clean and valid NYS Driver's License


Current First Aid Certification or ability to obtain within 3 months.

$17.34 - $19.07/hour depending on experience


Medical, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension and 403b and generous paid time off

  

UCP is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Personal Lines Account Manager
description:
Overview:
**Grow With Us!** At Hilb Group, we recognize that our associates are our greatest asset. We promote a service-driven culture of high performance that encourages career and professional development. The Hilb Group is currently seeking a motivated and ambitious Personal Lines Account Manager to join our team. This position will report to our agency located in Roseland, NJ. The ideal candidate will be motivated to succeed, is well organized, able to prioritize, and able to work well with a team. This is an-office position.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Proactively manage an assigned book of business acting as the primary client relationship manager with responsibility for overall account servicing and maintenance.
* Develop and maintain strong, long-term relationships with clients and insurance carriers.
* Handle inquiries regarding insurance coverages, policy changes and general insurance questions as related to all personal lines of business.
* Handle service and endorsement requests and process necessary paperwork associated with requests.
* Act as liaison between customer and carrier working closely with both to ensure a mutually beneficial relationship.
* Handle renewal/expiration list for assigned book of business, reviewing loss information, obtaining updated information, renewal applications, and negotiating renewal pricing when necessary.
* Maintain knowledge of all company systems and offerings
* Communicate professionally with key stakeholders both internal and external via phone, email, video, and audio conferencing.
* Provide insights and recommendations for improving client satisfaction and retention.
* Build clients through referrals
* Maintain accurate client files and documentation as required.

**Qualifications:**

* Personal insurance P&C license required. Experience in servicing clients personal insurance needs. Producer license in resident state
* Prior experience working with HNW accounts and carrier markets
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent preferred
* Knowledge and background in insurance
* Exceptional problem-solving, analysis, time management skills, communication skills, self-sufficient, and initiative-taker.
* Customer focused with the ability to build and maintain relationships.
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
* Comfortable with communicating professionally with internal and external stakeholders via phone, email, video, and audio conferencing.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and comfortable with starting and stopping projects to assist with urgent requests.

**Benefits:**

* Company Paid Life Insurance, Long-Term and Short-Term Disability.
* Medical, Dental, Vision and FSA/HSA plans.
* 401(k) with company match.
* Additional voluntary benefits including Critical Illness, Accident Insurance, Hospital Indemnity and Supplemental Life Insurance, Legal and Identity Protection, and Pet benefits.
* Generous PTO.
* An awesome team of professionals!


The Hilb Group is an equal opportunity employer, and we actively support and comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws prohibiting all forms of discrimination in employment. Additionally, we have a zero-tolerance policy for all forms of harassment in violation of federal, state, and local laws.

title: Dentistry Office Admin
description:
Are you ready to lead a thriving dental practice in Lynbrook, NY? If so, **Perfect Smile Dental Arts** is seeking a dedicated **Dentistry Office Admin** to join our team on a **full-time** basis.


But why should you join us? We're glad you asked!


As our Dentistry Office Admin, you'll earn a competitive starting pay of **$25 per hour**, plus commission. And the best part? We not only prioritize the well-being of our patients but also our employees, which is why we offer **amazing benefits and perks** that include:

* Dental coverage
* Paid time off (PTO)
* Education assistance
* A mentor/apprentice program
* Growth opportunities
* Uniforms
* Company parties
* Bonuses for full-time employees
* Flexible schedules for part-time employees

 **HOW YOU ENSURE SMILES SHINE BRIGHT:**


As our Dentistry Office Admin, you'll work a full-time Monday through Friday schedule between 8 AM and 5 PM. Every day, you'll play a vital role in our practice's success. You'll oversee day-to-day operations, including appointment scheduling, patient flow, and staff coordination. You will also ensure compliance with healthcare regulations, handle patient inquiries, manage financial activities, and develop office policies for optimal efficiency. Your role will extend to inventory management, patient record maintenance, and strategic planning to support practice growth. Join us and experience the excitement of leading a top-notch dental team!

 **HOW WE CHANGE LIVES ONE SMILE AT A TIME:**


Perfect Smile Dental Arts is dedicated to providing superior dental care in a warm and welcoming environment. Our mission is to help our community maintain optimal oral health through comprehensive and preventive patient care. We value teamwork, innovation, and patient satisfaction. With us, employees thrive in our cutting-edge, customer-obsessed, and results-driven culture. We provide a supportive workplace where contributions are valued and careers can flourish. Apply now to be part of a team committed to delivering outstanding dentistry services and creating beautiful smiles every day!

 **DON'T LET THIS AMAZING OPPORTUNITY PASS YOU BY!**


Ready to advance your office management career as our Dentistry Office Admin? Here's what we need from you:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Great leadership abilities
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail


Having previous management experience and the ability to implement processes with great follow-through skills is desirable. If you meet the qualifications listed above, apply today! Our initial application is quick, easy, and mobile-friendly. What are you waiting for?! Join our dental office for the opportunity of a lifetime!

title: Endodontics Specialist
description:
Rockland Dental Specialists in New City, NY is seeking a highly skilled **Endodontics Specialist** to join our esteemed team **part-time**. Our practice is renowned for providing exceptional dental care in a patient-centric environment. We offer **a competitive, commission-based salary of $280,000-$300,000**, **part-time flexibility**, and **a collaborative team dedicated to excellence**. If you are passionate about endodontic care and looking to advance your career, we invite you to apply.

 **ABOUT ROCKLAND DENTAL SPECIALISTS**


At Rockland Dental Specialists, our mission is simple - earn each patient's trust and deliver the highest quality personalized care. We specialize in periodontics and endodontics, providing advanced solutions with a focus on patient comfort. Our dedicated team exhibits genuine compassion, extraordinary commitment, and 24/7 availability to meet our patients' needs. We uphold a family-oriented, team-based environment so our employees have all the support they need to fully serve our patients.

 **ABOUT THE ROLE**


The **schedule** for this part-time role includes workdays on Monday or Tuesday and Friday, with exact details to be discussed to accommodate mutual preferences.


As an Endodontics Specialist at our state-of-the-art facility, you will perform a variety of procedures, including root canal treatments, retreatments, and apicoectomies. Your day will involve diagnosing and treating conditions related to the dental pulp and root tissues, collaborating with other specialists and general dentists to provide comprehensive care, and educating patients on oral health and preventive care. Your commitment to precision and patient comfort will be evident in your work and interactions with our team and patients.

 **WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED**

* DDS/DMD degree from an accredited dental school
* Completion of an accredited endodontic residency program
* Board eligible **or** board certified
* Valid NY state dental license
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
* Strong commitment to patient care and comfort

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 3+ years of experience in endodontics

**If you are ready to join a dedicated team and provide outstanding endodontic care as a part-time Endodontics Specialist, we encourage you to apply.** Our initial application process is brief and can be completed in just 3 minutes on any mobile device. We look forward to potentially welcoming you to our office, where excellence in patient care is our priority.a

title: Service Writer
description:
Are you passionate about automobiles and excellent customer service? Smithwest Service Center is looking for an experienced and knowledgeable Service Writer to join our team. As a Service Writer, you'll play a crucial role in bridging the gap between our customers and automotive technicians, ensuring top-notch service and customer satisfaction.

**Responsibilities:**

* Greet customers warmly and discuss their automotive service needs.
* Utilize automotive knowledge to understand and assess customer concerns.
* Create detailed service orders with accurate vehicle information and customer concerns.
* Communicate service recommendations from technicians to customers effectively.
* Provide cost estimates and repair timeframes to customers.
* Communicate with customers every three hours to keep them updated on the status of the repair and inform them if vehicle will not be completed that day.
* Schedule service appointments and coordinate with our receptionist and service manager for seamless operations.
* Follow up with customers post-service to ensure satisfaction and address any concerns.
* Maintain organized customer records and service history for future reference.
* Follow up with future recommendations for service work that needs to be completed.
* Order parts cost effective parts for higher profit margins and ensure that parts are correct prior to repair so repair is seamless.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum 3 years of experience in a dealership or independent repair facility.
* Automotive knowledge is mandatory with at least some technician background at a minimum of 2 years of experience.
* Valid driver's license.
* Computer skills and knowledge.
* Being able to stand and walk around the shop for long periods during the day and to customers vehicles.
* Being able to work in bad weather at times.
* Able to assist customer complaints in a professional manner.
* Well kept appearance all day.

**Benefits:**

* Comprehensive benefits package including medical, vision, dental, and life insurance after 90 days.
* Paid time off (PTO) starting at 90 days.
* Paid vacation after 1 year.
* 401(k) safe harbor retirement plan available after 90 days.
* Pension Fund eligibility after 90 days.

**Salary:**

* Competitive salary starting at $47,000 with weekly commission and monthly bonuses.


If you're ready to take on a rewarding role where you can utilize your automotive expertise and customer service skills, apply now to join our team at Smithwest Service Center. Let's drive success together!

title: Director, Materials Management
company: Hackensack Meridian Pascack Valley and Mountainside
description:
Overview: **Hackensack Meridian Mountainside Medical Center**has been serving Montclair and surrounding New Jersey communities since 1891. In collaboration with its joint venture partners, Ardent Health Services and Hackensack Meridian Health, Mountainside Medical Center is well positioned for future growth and continued excellence in providing care to Essex County and surrounding regions.

  


With the addition of innovative capabilities, Mountainside Medical Center’s respected medical and community reputation has gained even more strength. Ongoing collaboration with physicians and community leaders enables Mountainside Medical Center team to bring the latest medical programs, technology and patient-focused care to local communities.
* 365 beds
* 820,000 square feet
* More than 1,200+ employees
* Over 700+ medical staff members
* Board-certified and board eligible physicians
* 27-bed Emergency Room/Fast Track Unit
* Wireless internet access

 **POSITION SUMMARY**  

The overall responsibility of the **Director, Materials Management** is to provide effective management for the operations of the materials management department and is responsible for all operational, technical, and personnel activities associated with assigned areas of supply chain and inventory management. This position will focus on cost, quality, and outcomes. In some instances, this position may cover more than one facility or department, including but not limited to HOPD’s.  



Responsibilities:
* Selects, trains/orients and assigns departmental staff (either directly or through subordinate personnel. Develops standards of practice, performance metrics, evaluates performance and initiates or makes recommendations for personal actions.
* Develops and monitors a variety of analytical and statistical reports to assist with departmental forecasting and purchasing decisions.
* Investigates and analyzes supply cost variances and budgets; reports findings timely to necessary parties.
* Develops departmental (site) goals and objectives, and establishes and implements standardized policies and procedures for department operation throughout the system.
* Develops department operating budgets and ensures that departments operate within budget.
* Directs the preparation and maintenance of departmental reports by site; prepares periodic reports for executive management as required. Ensures that a fiscal inventory of asset locations is conducted as required. Maintains written procedures and coordinates the effort of the inventory team throughout the system with the Regional Director of Supply Chain Operations.
* Interacts effectively with vendors, internal departments, division leadership, and physicians to control new products, increase efficiencies, and mitigate price increases. Negotiates price and utilization contracts effectively, as assigned or needed.
* Facilitates product conversions effectively and timely. Collaborates with vendor, internal departments, physicians, and division leadership to ensure adequate savings and clinical acceptance.
* Oversees storage and issue of medical supplies and equipment, where affected. Analyzes current methods used in the processing of reusable supplies and equipment, from decontamination to assembling, packaging, storage, and makes changes as needed, exercising overall responsibility.
* Maintains integrity of the Materials Management Information System to ensure that adequate supply levels are available at all sites and discrepancies are resolved quickly.
* Manages and coordinates all phases of the par level storage locations, cart, and/or exchange cart in the nursing areas utilized at each site. (Chargeable and non-chargeable items, patient charge master, and the ERP system)
* May establish and oversee ancillary department activities (Mail Room, linen, tanks, etc), as well as the Supply Chain fleet delivery vehicles for the delivery of equipment and products, where applicable.
* Creates policies and procedures (standardized throughout Ardent) for inventory control and the issuing of supplies and equipment. Arranges and/or conducts in-services of new procedures at affected sites. Coordinates with other departments, as required.
* Stays informed through Purchasing and vendor representatives on new product information. Implements changes after consultation on price, feasibility and charging with the Supply Chain Leadership Team.
* Refines the interface with other departments to support excellence in patient care, promote enhanced service offerings, grow revenue, support quality parameters, and strengthen the Ardent brand
* Coordinates and assists in projects and providing oversight of third-party vendors in support of business expansion initiatives
* Manages supply chain and purchasing compliance with OSHA, hospital accrediting organization, DOH, CMS, etc.


Qualifications:
**Required Qualifications:*** Bachelor’s degree in a relevant subject area such as business, finance, supply chain or relevant field. Relevant experience will be considered in lieu of a degree
* Seven (7) years relevant experience in Supply Chain management/leadership within healthcare or related industry

**Preferred Qualifications:*** Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to include the ability to negotiate and resolve conflicts and build teams
* ERP system, such as Lawson, preferred
* Demonstrated creativity and flexibility
* Ability to operate in high-pressure situations
* Ability to work collaboratively across Ardent Health entities and disciplines
* Demonstrated commitment to patient- and family centered care
* Effective analytical ability to develop and analyze options, recommend solutions to and solve complex problems and issues
* Demonstrated effective managerial and administrative leadership of clinical operations
* Effective organizational, planning and project management abilities
* Experience in financial and programmatic presentations
* Ability to function independently and deal with multiple, simultaneous projects
* Ability to recognize personal strengths and weaknesses and develop goals for professional growth and achievement
* Ability to demonstrate a commitment to quality and excellence

title: Gutter Installer Apprentice / Helper
description:
**The Brothers That Just Do Gutters** of **Colts Neck, NJ** is currently hiring for a **Gutter Installer Apprentice / Helper** to assist our experienced gutter installation techs out in the field at the homes and businesses of our customers. This Apprentice position earns a **top starting pay** of **$13-$20 an hour**, based on experience. Production pay may also be possible based on experience. We are local industry leaders and believe that hard work can also be fun.


In addition to **great pay** and our **supportive culture**, we offer our Gutter Installer Apprentice/Helper the following benefits and perks:

* **PAID TIME OFF**
* **SICK TIME**
* **A 401(K) PLAN** (starting after 90 days of employment)


So, now that you've learned the who, what, where, and why, you may be wondering HOW? It's easy! Just fill out our initial **mobile-friendly online application**. We hope to meet you soon! Be sure to **ask about our sign-on bonus!**

 **OUR IDEAL GUTTER INSTALLER APPRENTICE / HELPER**

* Respectful - Treats others with kindness and dignity
* Willingness to learn- Can take instruction from others and is eager to learn new skills
* Career-minded -Looking for more than just a job
* Great attention to detail - Can complete tasks with thoroughness and accuracy
* Reliable - Shows up to work on time and prepared


If these ideal Gutter Installer Apprentice/Helper traits describe you, please continue reading!

 **ABOUT THE BROTHERS THAT JUST DO GUTTERS**


The Brothers That Just Do Gutters is a full-service rain gutter and gutter guard franchise. We repair, install and maintain everything from Seamless Gutter Guards to Specialty Gutters, and it doesn't stop there. No matter the job, our customers know they can count on The Brothers for quality craftsmanship and customer service.


We are big on personal and career growth, loyalty, and caring. We want our team to achieve their goals and aspirations. We fully invest in our team and strive to curate a comfortable work environment. We provide positive, professional, and respectful communication with every fellow employee. Through our provided training, defined career paths, and promotions from within, it is easy to succeed. Our great culture is also supported through **company events** that encourage employee interaction and interpersonal relationships. Don't settle for a fixer-upper career, join us!

 **GUTTER INSTALLER APPRENTICE / HELPER REQUIREMENTS**


As an Apprentice Gutter Installer for us, you help them, you help our experienced installers and they mentor you on everything from how to talk with customers to how to properly install, service, and repair gutters. You must be eager to learn and happy to help. If you can do this and meet the following requirements, we would be happy to have you as part of our team!

* Must be 18 or older
* Must have a valid drivers license

**Install experience is preferred, but not required. We will train the right person!** Are you an honest, hard-working individual? Do you have effective communication skills? Are you punctual and reliable? Do you pay attention to detail? Are you a self-starter who is willing to ask questions? If yes, give us the chance to review your information.

 **ARE YOU READY?**


If you are excited about this Apprentice/Helper opportunity, don't delay. **Apply today**!
